text:
Is it possible to call on brand colors ie from javascript? :      Since the tags are rendered before the js is executed, I need to be able to call on these colors
```{{brand_settings.colors[' + i + '].hex}}```

Hi everybody!! :slightly_smiling_face:

I create a private App .. and want to enroll a workflow through the API. But look's that i have a scope problem:

"This oauth-token (xxxxxx) does not have proper permissions! (requires all of [workflows-access])"
So, pls, which permissions i should to add? My current are these:
might be "automation" scope that you are missing

no you cannot selectively apply this setting. if you have ops hub pro (custom code actions in workflows) or use an integration like associ8 you can usually mock the auto-association behavior and then modify/restrict it the way you want
Thank you for the reply, I will look into custom code actions

*#Hey there everyone, I am having this error while passing an access token which is actually a oauth token here ->*
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm-objects/v1/objects/tickets>
<https://prnt.sc/Z59wYr4vyI1O>

Access token is generated using this endpoint ->
<https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token>
Do you have the tickets scope?
Also it's best to use the v3 or v4 endpoints not v1s are deprecated

Hi everyone! Brief question,  when using the *`/crm/v3/owners/`*  endpoint, the response contains an `id` (assuming is the owner id) and also a `userId`. So I am a bit confuse and I couldnt find an answer.
What is the difference between these two? Thanks!

User id is basically the special code for HubSpot users this code will be send to custom crm cards when a user takes an action on something. The owner id is just the id you can use to assign records to certain people
Also when you update a record the user id will shown as a way to identify the person that made the update
